page.title: 08Industrial Philadelphia
page.content: Philadelphia is a village that grew with the Industrial Revolution and the Coal Industry. A number of pits were located around the village but the main one was the Dorothy or {"Dolly" Pit.}All that is left of it today is the fenced off shaft which now acts as a ventilation shaft for the Herrington Mine. The main stores for the Northern Region of the{NCB}are located here along with one of the main{Engineering {Works}none locally as "Phili-Yard". Alongside this is the{Bus Depot which has a repair shop and washing shop for buses which serve the Sunderland Area. It used to house the old trams that ran to Sunderland.On the main road through the village from Newbottle to Shiney Row there is a {railway crossing}for trains between the pit & the coke works to the south.
